content.content: TL;DR: We expect to have the August 9 Executive or a replacement ready by Friday. We will be making a final call on Thursday and updating the community with further information.  Executive Delay For those monitoring the #new-spells channel in Discord, it’s not a surprise that we have run into a few issues with the spell prepared for tomorrow. Ultimately, we are waiting for communication from a trading firm on swapping the most recent batch of 25M DAI for USD. Note this delay is unrelated to RWF-001 and the proposed RWF-0x, and entirely based on our designated broker citing compliance concerns. Ultimately, after discussion with the other @Core-Facilitators (and mandated actors) GovAlpha agrees that the best course of action at the moment is to wait for more communications and plan for a replacement spell to be issued at the end of the week if we do not get further clarity on the situation.  Next Steps CUs and Stakeholders will be in contact with our partners to see if we can reach a speedy solution for the last 25M DAI sent. In the meantime, GovAlpha will not be putting any spells onto the voting portal that include more distributions to the trading partner and will update the community when that position changes.  Questions and Concerns Most pressing (in the view of the mandated actors) is the fate of the 25M DAI sent to the trading partner. We are in communication with the trading partner to figure out what their plan is and how both sides wish to proceed given this new hesitancy for converting DAI for this vault facility. While the legal agreements were put in place to help alleviate concerns in situations such as these, it would not be prudent in our view to continue sending funds without clarity on their fate. I encourage the community to use this thread for further inquiries, and GovAlpha will post links to the following updates here so anyone concerned with the situation can follow allow by turning notifications on for this thread.
Much appreciated.
prose11:  and entirely based on our designated broker citing compliance concerns.   Could you elaborate a little further on the concerns the broker has expressed?

prose11:  entirely based on our designated broker citing compliance concerns.   What is the nature of the compliance concerns? Are they related to recent U.S. Treasury Department actions pertaining to Tornado Cash or any NEW specific communications Genesis has received from authorities or their own regulators? Who is handling this extremely sensitive matter? Delegate Compensation should be split from the Executive and posted separately on-time.

@ACREinvest I posted a reply in the RWF Discord that goes into further detail but will summarize here. Genesis’ compliance concerns were around a technicality in the structure where under Cayman law the Foundation Supervisor is considered a beneficial owner, but from Genesis’ perspective they are not, and they cannot process a trade without KYC on a beneficial owner (even if from their perspective there isn’t one). Boxes need to be checked, even if they don’t make very much sense. It’s all very technical and, in my opinion, has nothing to do with Tornado Cash or any other recent actions. Since I’m contracted by the bank and not the RWA Foundation, I can’t give Genesis direction. I’ve only been acting in a clarifying capacity along with @christiancdpetersen who has been extremely helpful. My next steps will be to work with the Delegated Committee outlined in the  HVB application to brainstorm solutions and ultimately have them provide advice to the Cayman Foundation. EDIT: To be clear about the implications, they are sending the Dai back that they currently have and Maker will need to remove the drawdowns from future execs until this is sorted.

g_dip:  Genesis’ compliance concerns were around a technicality in the structure where under Cayman law the Foundation Supervisor is considered a beneficial owner, but from Genesis’ perspective they are not, and they cannot process a trade without KYC on a beneficial owner (even if from their perspective there isn’t one).   Was this issue just discovered now?
Somehow yes. As you know, the first tranche was executed without a problem.

@MFeinberg and @ACREinvest - I concur with @g_dip’s summary. It is puzzling because RWA Foundation satisfactorily passed KYC with Genesis before it could even open the account and make any transactions. I also note that RWA Foundation and Genesis, as part of the HVB transaction, actually signed an agreement that pre-determines how Genesis will handle DAI/USD received during the life of the transaction. That was all apparently okay until it wasn’t. I cannot actually provide any further insights because Genesis has not given us the pathway to square the circle. We have provided Genesis with more than enough information (RWA Foundation articles of association, register of members, directors and officers, authorized signatory list for the corporate director, etc.). We have also provided a legal memorandum from Cayman counsel that identifies, for purposes of Cayman law, that the supervisor is the “beneficial owner”. @g_dip and I are evaluating with CES the next steps. But it is deeply disappointing because the “cash flow pipes” worked as designed for the 1st transfer to Genesis and then from Genesis to the RWA Master Participation Trust.

Thanks for the post! So is Genesis failing to live up to its contractual obligations? Without more of an explanation on their end it seems to possibly be in bad faith. I do not know which parties are in privity with each other but this seems fishy.

g_dip:  EDIT: To be clear about the implications, they are sending the Dai back that they currently have and Maker will need to remove the drawdowns from future execs until this is sorted.   Thanks very much for the update and @christiancdpetersen for additional color. How is this being discussed with HVB and who is involved given circumstance with RWF? Very grateful to the teams working for continuity and to preserve the DAOs reputation and hard work achieved to date. Thank you @christiancdpetersen @Eumenes @teej @monkey.irish

@christiancdpetersen @Eumenes @teej What questions have we asked Genesis about their exposure to 3AC and specific assurances as to their ability to continue business as usual? We know from public documents and reports that their exposure was in the billion(s) and their parent company DCG needed to step in. Bloomberg reports the facts as follows: Genesis had earlier disclosed that it was exposed to Three Arrows, and a July 9 filing in Singapore high court lists a $2.36 billion loan to the fund from Genesis Asia Pacific Pte Ltd. Genesis sold collateral and hedged its downside once Three Arrows failed to meet a margin call, Michael Moro, chief executive officer of Genesis, said in a series of tweets this month, without specifying the hedging strategy it employed. The loans to Three Arrows had a weighted-average margin requirement of over 80%, he said, without disclosing the total loan amount or the economic loss. Digital Currency Group has since assumed some of these liabilities. “Both the DCG and Genesis balance sheets remain strong. With no remaining exposure to Three Arrows Capital, Genesis continues to be well-capitalized and its operations are business as usual,” a spokesperson for DCG said in an emailed statement. https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-07-18/three-arrows-said-to-owe-digital-currency-group-1-2-billion

Update posted here:    Urgent Executive Inclusion Request Updates       This forum post serves as notification for the return of 25 million Dai to MakerDAO from Genesis Global Trading, Inc. (GGT) regarding the second HVBank transaction.  Notwithstanding having previously completed KYC/AML review for RWA Foundation and having completed a first DAI-USD conversion for RWA Foundation on Thursday, August 4, 2022, Genesis Global Trading, Inc. (GGT) has now determined that it is unable to undertake DAI-US Dollar conversions for RWA Foundation.  As a consequence, the 25 mil…     Present plan is to get this inserted in the copy and run with the spell posting tomorrow. Contents will be the same, but with this legal update in place of the drawdown for HVBank.

ACREinvest:  How is this being discussed with HVB and who is involved given circumstance with RWF?   @g_dip and I have briefed HVB on the current status. Ankura Trust is also well-informed of the situation as Ankura Trust will be required to change the wallet address (assuming approval of the MKR token holders).     ACREinvest:  What questions have we asked Genesis about their exposure to 3AC and specific assurances as to their ability to continue business a   Specifically, we have not asked Genesis about 3AC exposure. The original determination to have 4 executive spells at 25 million DAI each arose from assurance from Genesis that it would be able to complete those trades on a same day basis.

I recently spoke to Genesis and passed along these questions.   According to them the 3AC issue is completely in the rear-view mirror and they are fully solvent. The debt was assumed by DCG and they are in good financial condition. DCG also put out their quarterly report recently, if you can get your hands on that…   The decision to stop the transaction did NOT come from a regulator and is entirely internal. They are still interested in figuring out a way to make things work assuming they can check all their boxes.

@christiancdpetersen Did you all bring up with Genesis KYC’ing the RWA Foundation’s directors? It has directors, no? I have not followed this closely. FWIW, Genesis should accept the directors as “operators” of the Foundation for KYC purposes and thus, be able to satisfy their internal compliance requirements.

Yup. Have gone through this ad nauseam with them (also keep in mind this was sufficient prior to their sudden about-face). I am still trying though. I have also asked who they might KYC at a Foundation (an entity type I’m quite sure they do a lot of business with) if not its Directors, but have yet to receive an answer.
g_dip:  assuming they can check all their boxes.   I don’t like the sound of that.

Well their boxes are just that they can properly KYC the entity. It’s still very possible that this entire issue is a miscommunication that will be cleared up in the next few days. I can assure the community that everyone involved with the transaction is working hard on this and that Genesis has repeatedly committed to trying to get this done if they can satisfy compliance. I’m also exploring alternative brokers to facilitate the trade. Either way, we’ll get this fixed and have $100M of RWA in the near future. Keep in mind, the first $25M is at the Trust and HVB is going to begin participating loans – there are bright spots!

g_dip:  Well their boxes are just that they can properly KYC the entity.   Correct me if I’m wrong, but the Trust Sponsor (RWA Foundation) is an orphan structure. How will such get KYC? Sounds like this type of structure does not scale without the approval of centralized intermediaries. If so, this structure should have never been considered by MakerDAO. It also means that MakerDAO getting its money back will also be dependent of intermediaries willingness to comply w/the same orphan structure. Am I wrong?

RWA Foundation provided the information requested by Genesis as part of its on-boarding process, including RWA Foundation’s Director (which is a corporate entity). I have provided Genesis with the list of authorized signatories for the Director. This does not seem to have made any difference.

The Trust Sponsor is an orphaned entity established under the laws of the Cayman Islands. Cayman Islands law recognizes the “supervisor” as the beneficial owner.     flipflopflapdelegate:  Sounds like this type of structure does not scale without the approval of centralized intermediaries.   Every structure will be required to undertake KYC. A charitable trust, a STAR trust, a company, a partnership, etc. The Cayman foundation company is not any different.     flipflopflapdelegate:  If so, this structure should have never been considered by MakerDAO.   On what basis? Cayman counsel advised on the use of the Cayman foundation entity over other available options. As you may know more than I, many crypto projects utilize the Cayman foundation as a legal entity. Further, each of the other parties in the transaction chained completed KYC of RWA Foundation without any issue and at least one of them confirmed the same to Genesis.     flipflopflapdelegate:  It also means that MakerDAO getting its money back will also be dependent of intermediaries willingness to comply w/the same orphan structure. Am I wrong?   Genesis has asked that RWA Foundation update the portal with the RWA Urn address so that it may send the DAI back to RWA Urn. As indicated Here, the process has been initiated to have the MKR voters approve the change of wallet address. As a principal matter, for Maker to integrate into real world, the best option is for an orphaned structure.
I hear ya, I just have a hard time understanding how this would come up now. And I understand it goes beyond the control of RWA, it’s the timing I don’t love.
There is no RWA structure that doesn’t require intermediaries. At some point, someone needs to convert Dai to USD.

Thanks for all the patience and grace in this developing situation. Happy to announce the spell is live for the community’s consideration: https://vote.makerdao.com/executive/template-executive-vote-momc-parameter-changes-socgen-vault-drawdown-authorization-recognized-delegate-compensation-hvbank-legal-agreement-amendment-august-12-2022#proposal-detail

Hi everyone, I have good news. The issues at Genesis have been cleared up by way of the RWA Foundation providing additional information. The entity is back in good standing with their compliance team and is proceeding with the conversion of the 25M Dai they have in their possession.

g_dip:  e issues at Genesis have been cleared up by way of the RWA Foundation providing additional information. The entity is back in good standing with their compliance team and is proceeding with the conversion of the 25M Dai they have in their possession.    On the Governance end we’ll be waiting for this conversation to be taken care of before scheduling more drawdowns/transfers, but seems like we won’t be waiting long. Thanks for all the heavy lifting on your end Greg and for keeping the community updated as things progress.
This topic was automatically closed 14 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
